title: The Wilbour Papyrus
description:
The Great Wilbour Papyrus, hieratic papyrus of 4500 lines distributed over 102 columns; a later text on the verso comprises 723 lines on 25 pages.
Recto: Text A – records the measurement and assessment of a large number of fields in Middle Egypt.
Verso: Text B – consists of a list of royal lands arranged under headings that name the officials responsible for their administration.

museum_location.name: This item is not on view
